reviews.text: Awesome service, delicious food and affordable prices!

The food and drinks were great but we didn't feel like we were checked on much as well as they weren't talkative. Just the start of taking the order and that was it. Didn't see if we wanted dessert. They did see if we wanted more than just appetizers & drinks which was good but wanted more attention. Over all, a good experience.

From the moment we walked in, the atmosphere was friendly and inviting. The host, the young lady who walked us to our table, and another young lady we walked past were all refreshingly friendly and pleasant! Our server Abraham was amazing, the food came out quickly and was delicious. 10/10 will recommend this location and will return in the future!

I don’t typically write reviews but we came on the later side on a Monday and ate at the bar and the staff couldn’t have been nicer. Dwayne and Fee were so welcoming as well as the other bartender who’s name escapes me. They didn’t make us feel rushed and just overall provided excellent service. Food and drinks were great. We will be back!

Went 2 other places on the strip that we got a drink 10 min and 20 min later still couldn't order. Went here despite husband's "it is a chain comments." Great service. Great food. This isn't your normal chain. You won't regret it.

CREDITE CARD USERS, BE AWARE!!!
Watch for unauthorized charges! More than one occasion the waiter/waitresses in this restaurant charged my credit card twice or double dipped their tips. I believe the management is aware of these practices because both times, I called to speak with the manager, both times, the manager did not take my calls or returned my voice message however, both times the unauthorized charges were (disapperd) reversed from my bank statement.
This is how they do it, first they charge the total bill, the authorized bill and tips together, then they go back for a second time and charge tips only which is not authorized by the way. I assume this practices are illegal in the state of Maryland.
Customers, who don’t pay attention to their statements assuming that the tips were billed separately would not complain. If customers don’t complain, the rest is history, the waiters/waitresses get away with it and they keep your money without your authorization. If you call to complain, make sure to take a screen shot of the charges before you call management otherwise, after you call the overcharge dispappears mysteriously from your banks stayement regardless whether you speak with the manager or not. Be careful, check your charges or bank’s statements!
the food is average

We wanted something a bit light and casual for dinner so we decided to try this Panera bread. Dining experience- need more booths, dirty tables, and dirty floors too. Food - my bread was too hard. Salad lettuce a good crunch but I could use more greens. There was no baked goods at the counter or pastries either. Staff - friendly and quick. Overall, i would not recommend this location.

I should be a broccoli and cheddar soup quality control manager going around all the Paneras of the world and making sure they keep the consistency and heat levels good at the cafes~

Broccoli and Cheddar: Good as always and what you expect for this soup. surprisingly, this soup had larger chunks of broccoli than usual, it was awesome, nice tastes and good'ol Panera quality.

Very slow with our order!
We're vacationing here from Florida and came in for breakfast.
Our order # 112793, Guest #793.
The nicest was the cashier.
The person making our order hair hung low and is long.
It took over 15 min to make two turkey sandwiches and we were the only ones waiting for the first 15. We inquired twice and were ignored.
Will definitely not return.
Came here for the first time with my boyfriend. I enjoyed every bite. The soups was the best I ever had. The staff were polite. Good experience all around.

I always come to Panera and they have a good pastry. I love there chocolate croissant it’s so good. Also Asmeret Habte is one of the best employee I have seen in Panera. She is very polite and a friendly attitude.

William the general manager personally came out to ask how my food was. He said the crab was all fresh & never frozen and it sure was fresh. Check out the pictures of this JUMBO LUMP CRAKE CAKE!! 👀 All crab! No cake! Better than most seafood places I've been too!! Genuine, authentic, honest food and ingredients!

Want a good cheeseburger and fries? Well this is a great option. It was juicy and flavorful cooked to the right temperature. The fries were fresh and hot. Two thumbs up. Good, friendly and attentive bartender.

The food here is tasty and inexpensive (always has been). They have a good selection of beer, and cocktails, but I think their wine list can grow a little. I had the wings and Prosecco, and my fiancé had their Reuben sandwich with a Blue Moon. He mentioned their house made chips were pretty good. The only complaint I have about this place is cleanliness. It smelled old and like mildew in some places. I wasn’t too thrilled as it lingered the entire time we ate, but it’s not unbearable. Other than that, our waitress was very friendly, and the service was pretty quick!

My friend and I were recommended this pasta by numerous of people, and had to come and try it (one of the best pastas I’ve had so far). This restaurant offers awesome service as well as tasty food. We came on karaoke night and it was a memorable experience. The food and drinks served quick and the prices were affordable. Recommended.
Just as good the 2nd time around. ,Chicken and Waffles, Hash. Brunch Punch. Service was excellent. Quick seating. Vaccination confirmation for Indoor seating.

What a cool place and a true hidden gem in Silver Spring! Extensive selections of great beer and liquor. Food is amazing too. Got a burger and tots basket with cheese, and both are perfectly delicious. Service is fast and friendly as well. What’s not to love?

This was a cool little place that we kind of stumbled upon. A nifty funky vibe awesome food by the way. Alexander the server was scooting around the restaurant very hard worker. The food portions are definitely fair I recommend the hot wings and/or the burger that has the egg and bacon on it. I’m sure all of it’s delicious but that’s what I had. Would definitely will come here again when in town.

Went to see a small show. Spent most of my focused on the show but it seemed like a cool place. The venue was separate and intimate from the rest of the place, but that seemed like a cool, chill place too. I did get a burger and a beer while the band was setting up. The burger was good and the prices weren't bad for the DC area. If I lived closer I'd probably be here all the time.

I really like this bar. I can’t believe how long it took me to actually try it out! Well I did move to silver spring at like the peak of the pandemic so maybe it was closed. I think it was closed. Anyway holy heck this place has great beer, great food, and great vibes. I feel like there are just constant great jams playing on the juke box. The happy hour prices are legit. The wife and i got burgers and like 2 to 3 beers each and an appetizer and tater tots and it didn’t feel like we broke the bank (which is great for this area). The burgers are friggin delicious! Holy hell though, the after burner burger is HOT. Like I enjoy spicy but this is the first time in living memory I actually took some of the spice off of my burger just so I could finish it. My intestines are still pretty angry at me the following afternoon. Just a word of warning. The pictured burger in this review is a chophouse style… that’s a much safer bet.

I honestly can’t wait to go back it’s just that good though. I just know now to spare my gastrointestinal tract the searing inferno that is the afterburner burger.

Great Dive Bar, keeping it real in the midst of a glass and steel downtown Silver Spring.

Draft beer list of about a dozen rotates seasonally and has something for everyone. Looking for something in particular? There's a massive craft beer list!

Burgers are a mainstay at QH, but try the fried onion rings too. Tater tots are surprisingly good as well. The secret? They set the deep fryer temp high which makes the fried foods crisp and not greasy. Vegan options are available and also tasty. Interesting seasonal offerings keep the menu dynamic and the regulars coming back for more

Service is great, prompt and efficient, yet personal.

Nice to see this long-standing local hangout thriving in the middle of the chain restaurant wasteland that Silver Spring has become.

Highly recommended!

Great food for the price! Lots of options and the Asian dishes were really good. Seafood option are a lot, for the price they charge. The line was across the mall, about 30mins wait on a Sunday at noon. It’s crowded and packed around the buffet. The staffs where quick and prompt with clearing tables and providing needed services.

I love their pho. You can choose four types of meat. I chose beef and seafood only, and it was so good. Their fried shrimp and crawfish were tasty. I give them five stars due to their delicious food. However, the price is considered pricy. Customers should get crab leg or any selection of seafood for that price; I'm just saying.

This place was packed when i went in and the food was okay, not great some things were mediocre. Most things were flavourless & greasy, I had to add salt to everything and the shrimp was very difficult to get through for such a disappointing taste. The best thing I ate was the Jack n' Jill ice cream , in my opinion there are better buffets you could attend for the same relative price.

Visited there with my friend,  we were going back to home from DC one day. God! We were so hungry,  I wanted something really heavy, though I don't eat that much. My friend recommended this place. He said  let's go hit Blue pearl, I was never been there before, but I was like like okayy. Ohh woww amazing Place with lots of options, probably take long time to figure out what you gonna pick next...😃 but yeahh nice employees,  great atmosphere. Gonna go back there pretty soon.

If you are not afraid of rats ,I guess you can visit , as I was having dinner a rat walked, not ran ,walked!!, Under the table of customers ,the waitress did nothing after she was told about it. Eat at your own risk.

A great place for a night out on the town. All the staff we encountered with were all incredibly professional and attentive — huge shout out to everyone. We went for dinner and the interior had a very romantic ambience. The menu wasn’t too terribly long and all the items we received tasted great and the portions were quite generous (we were genuinely beginning to feel full after the two appetizers we ordered). Their shoestring fries were very thin and crunchy — in a good way. The service was fast and you don’t have to worry about what’s taking so long to get your food. Definitely a great location for a date night. We did ended up taking half the sandwich home.

This location (recently reopened) is nice and is a great dining option in downtown Silver Spring. Dining areas are spacious and the bar has a great ambiance too.  When I visit, I usually order a drink, the cornbread skillet, a salad, and either the Salmon entree or the rack of Ribs.  I love the mashed potatoes and the sauteed spinach is perfect.  For desert, the bread pudding is my fave.  It has a nice texture and a yummy glaze.  It's definitely  enough for two people.  Overall, the menu has nice options and there are also seasonal offerings on the menu.

Great dining atmosphere, customer service is nice, there's not a long wait for food to come your table, and yummy menu offerings.

Great large portions of dishes like steaks, chicken  and seafood. Lighting was extremely dark with a few lit areas. My nut crusted trout was excellent, as were the chicken pot pie made from scratch and the steak. Sides were plenty: mashed potatoes, Cole slaw, spinach and more. Drink specials with cocktails and full bar. Good micro brews beer. Service was professional but not always around.

Let me start by saying I have never enjoyed " service " so much!!

The wait staff are friendly, efficient, well dressed, attentive,  and they even love the food here.

Their suggestions were wonderful.

The place is very attractive.
You would bring family for special occasions or simply a night out.

Or  just bring a Tinder date😁...

We had a beautiful time from coffee to dessert.

You can rely on what I have to say about this restaurant
I  can  "over" analyze a piece of lint.

Have Fun

The good was the location and the food. Good atmosphere.

The bad: Not too busy when we entered but initially the host was going to sit two (black) people in a segregated back room. During this time there were other patrons in the restaurant with plenty of empty tables. My guest and I declined to sit in the other section. Service was subpar. Once I needed a refill on my drink and had to go to the bar myself to ask for it. If your going to charged market price for food, I don't expect to have to get up and ask the bar staff for service. The table behind us got checked on multiple times and asked about their meal. No on ever checked on us or asked us how things were going. Most of the meal I rarely saw my server. The food was good but maybe be prepared for lack of service.

Brunch date !! I was thoroughly excited to review this place and enjoy the hype surrounded by this popular spot! We made reservations for a Saturday brunch at 12pm. We arrived promptly and didn’t know they actually were just opening and waiting a few to be seated. We were seated and greeted and ordered the mimosas- bottomless of course ( awesome deal!!). We ordered the Caribbean rolls (fabulous !!) the fried chicken (delicious and cooked with love) Mac and cheese (standard, not seasoned - nothing to write home about), potatoes (not seasoned enough) shrimp and grits (I was SO excited but it fell so short of the hype of this place, I didn’t even finish, I ate the shrimp which had SOME shelled and de-shelled shrimp in it, it said cheese grits and they weren’t and all in all - skip it) and honey butter biscuit ( they were literal to the description and were ok). The chef actually brought out all the food to our table and was very friendly and that definitely added to our experience. The music selection most certainly kept it lovely !! The atmosphere was dope and I can tell the night time service is definitely something to be had! All in all I’d return for a happy hour social visit !

Some friends and I ate at society last night at around 7 for a late dinner. The overall experience was ok at best. The restaurant was obnoxiously loud and the service just wasn’t good. We saw our server maybe three times throughout dinner. Towards the end we waited for around 20 minutes just to get out check and pay. The food was pretty good, I enjoyed the Cajun pasta.
Always a vibe. Love brunch here. Bottomless Bellini and mimosas are a must! The lamb chops here are excellent and my friend likes the wings.

As at Feb 2023 the rooftop area is being renovated and closed off. Server was particularly great this evening, she went above and beyond to make sure we were ok. They only have limited menu after certain time at night but finding a seat was for a group of 3 was relatively easy. This place used to be super pack but they now have a few competitors nearby plus ongoing renovations.

Restaurant/lounge that caters to parties at night. The curry lobster and shrimp was absolutely delicious. Washed it down with a Casamigos cocktail courtesy of the fantastic bartender. Wonderful experience.

Went here for breakfast this past weekend. Very short wait and friendly staff. Your standard diner with great staff and really good food.

All the stuff we got was cooked perfectly and tasted great. The biscuits and gravy was especially yummy!

Our waitress was awesome and did a great job especially as she had a huge number of tables to wait. Super friendly and always around.

Overall great location for a good and great priced breakfast. I highly recommend!
Meet family here for breakfast.  We had a great time. Our server Zizi was great. My brother loves the salmon cakes and my husband really liked his waffle.   Everyone loved their fried potatoes  (yum)
Really good diner food. Everything was pretty basic for a diner, but I love diners so this hot the spot for me. Biscuits were a bit toasty, but they still tasted really good.

Oh what a place. it's a local diner thst serves affordable meals. don't expect the world from this place but they do have pretty epic pancakes. I always get coffee here but it's so so. honestly it's a diner and you get what you get.

The service was wonderful, helpful friendly staff. Food taste okay, I ordered the veggie omelet, home fries, water, and coffee. I enjoyed listening to music of my choice during the wait for my food which was not long. The view is great, nice area. Clean restaurant. I will visit again for the overall experience and great customer service... will order something different next time.

My favorite neighborhood spot in Silver Spring! Amazing food and large portions for a reasonable price. Huge menu but you can’t go wrong with the curry or noodles with Burmese dressing. Dishes are extremely spicy so keep that in mind when choosing mild/medium/hot. Support this local business!

SO GOOD. My mom grew up in Burma and we visited here while we were in town - can confirm that it is authentic and delicious Burmese food. If it’s your first time and you’re unfamiliar with the menu, don’t let that stop you - I’d recommend trying their OhnNo KaukSwe, NanJee Thoke, and Nyat KaukSwe Gyaw (all featured in the photos). I just wish this place existed in Chicago! Thank you to the lovely family who owns this place for showing us so much hospitality! :) 🙏🏼 ps. right now it’s only takeout!
Great experience. Delicious food. Friendly service. I wish I lived closer so that I could come back more often.

By far one of my favorite restaurants. I am over the moon that they’ve managed to reopen. Apparently, the family lost everything during COVID, but they’re trying again. Albeit only open for carry out right now while they save money to buy back tables and chairs and kitchen items. They had to sell everything. Thank goodness they’re back! I just had my favorite trio - pickled mango pork, curry chick peas with scallions and coconuts chicken curry. It was even better than I remembered.

We ordered the green tea leaf salad, shrimp coconut curry, noodles with pork, and the Sunday chicken special  - first time trying Burmese food so we went with their recommendations and loved everything. Service is exceptional and quick. Also they threw in a free dessert. Plus there is on-site parking.

name: Chick-fil-A
vicinity: 825 Ellsworth Drive Lot D1 - A, Silver Spring

reviews.text: One star is generous. I order from this chick fila and they always forget the sauces. This is the only one near my job. Their customer service is not the best. First chick fila where I get terrible customer service. When I called in the lady gave me attitude and hung up. Then spoke with manager and he stated that they added the sauces in bag. I informed him this is not the first time. I know it’s just sauce but come on, who eats chick fila plain ? Of course I am upset with no sauces. I had to pay for door dash. The manager stated that I should call door dash to get a refund. It is not door dash fault at all because all they do is delivery not prepare the food. This chick fila needs to do better.

It's a convenient location for my family. However, the staff are more interested in talking amongst themselves than helping customers. I waited at the mobile pickup for 4 minutes because the girl working the area was laughing and talking with a coworker. I wasn't told there was no lettuce, I was just given a sandwich with bitter greens on it. The store is nice and clean.

Ran out of nuggets while there.  it happens. was told 5 minutes after I ordered and paid.  what can you do? 15 minutes later, they ran out of fries...  okay, bummer. Then they started getting other people who came in after me out the door (and offered them food for their wait). about 25 minutes after ordering, got my food and the nuggets weren't it.  probably wait a minute before I go back but it was a bad experience.

The Short, Hispanic manager with blonde hair she is very, very very very rude, she was arguing back-and-forth with several customers, and two of us have to come into the store because we waited 20 minutes for a curbside pick up order, and she had the nerve to argue back-and-forth with us Chick-fil-A please have better management and customer service. I am very appalled and I’m never eating here again!

It truly never fails. Every time I come to this Chick Fil A, whether or not I place a mobile order I'll be waiting at least twenty minutes. The employees always look like they don't want to be there and how unprofessional it’s there is surreal. No matter the time of day either, a very long wait will be guaranteed. Today I made the mistake to go back to get a quick meal but after waiting almost thirty minutes the manager decided to give me a refund. Then I'd need to wait three more minutes to get what I ordered but with me being thoroughly disappointed with this whole establishment; I declined and decided to leave because I really would rather to spend not another second in that place. Needless to say, I will not be returning there and I do not recommend. Chick Fil A is truly not what it used to be.

The Pad See Ew was so delicious. The portions they give you are very big and the price is about right considering that you get quality food. The Fried Bananas and Coconut Ice Cream were excellent. There are crunchy pieces of coconut in the ice cream! The ambiance is very nice and relaxing. Overall this might be my new favorite Thai spot and would recommend others to come.

So thankful for a short trip to Washington DC and made me think about this restaurant that I visited friends in Silver spring 4 years ago. The food is so delicious and never disappointed me. Make me feel like home. Thank you so much for fabulous authentic Thai food.
The food & service where both great! Appetizers, dinner & especially dessert was delicious we will definitely be back to dine.
Delicious dishes, clean and lovely kind staff.  I had the Thai Noodle soup so well. I would recommend this quiet spot on the 2nd floor in the heart of Silver Spring.✌❤

Honestly, my girlfriend and I didn't expect much when we came in desperate for food after running errands. Furthermore, I am VERY picky with Thai food. After living in New York City, it can be difficult to find Thai restaurants that live up to Brooklyn quality. I was amazed at how good our four appetizers were. The peanut sauce was the second best I have ever had and I found myself wanting much, much more of it. The tofu was nice and dry and cooked perfectly. My partner's mussels were in her words "the bomb dot com". The prices are a little high but the quality and large portions easily make up for that. Staff is nice and very helpful. Would come again and recommend to others. Ignore the one-star reviews on here. They're mostly incredibly entitled and ocassionally racist.

name: Ghar-E-Kabab Indian Restaurant & Bar | Best Indian food | Best Indian Curry | Best Nepali Food

reviews.text: My husband and 20 year old son dined here for the first time on Sunday.  The food was sooooo good and the staff incredibly friendly. We tried both Ethiopian and Indian dishes and were so impressed.  We will definitely be back!  The picture I'm posting is mid-meal.  I highly recommend the ochra on the Indian menu.
Sweet vibe, homely and surprisingly really good food! I subbed njera with basmati rice. Late hours is my favorite.

The food was great! Especially loved the Ethiopian food. The staff was super friendly and the cook came out and explained the Ethiopian food we were eating. Don't get that very often. What fun! The place is very clean and the food comes out pretty quickly. I highly recommend the place and I'll be taking my family there again. Also very convenient that it was open late on a Sunday.

Good food, but awful bait-and-switch service on the lunch buffet. This is our third time eating at this restaurant, but our first time getting their advertised lunch buffet. On their menu they stated they are serving a lunch buffet and when we arrived at 12:30PM we asked the waiter before we sat down whether they are still doing the lunch buffet (otherwise we’d just go elsewhere) and the waiter confirmed that because of the pandemic we will have a “table side lunch buffet” and that he will bring out the food to us. We agreed to that and sat down. We received one tray of the food shown in the picture and when we asked to get more food once we finished (since we were told it’s a buffet) he said he had to go ask someone. He came back and said no, he can’t give us more food. We were so confused by the entire situation and to realize we basically got scammed into thinking that we were getting a lunch buffet by this waiter and all we received was one tray of sampler items was enough to make us not want to go back.
Delicious food. Funny waitress. Cute 2-person tables outside. It took a very long time for our bill to come, which was the only negative. I would absolutely go again. Highly recommended!

Delicious chicken soft tacos! The tomatoes were fresh, plenty of sour cream and the soft taco shell was sooo good.

Lots of outdoor seating and good amount of indoor seating. Clean and super friendly service. We did not order drinks but they have pitchers of frozen margaritas that looked good.

Endless chips and salsa with meal. Will be back for more of those soft tacos!

Walkable from Silver Spring metro station.

Hidden gem and sports bar style Tex-Mex restaurant in the silver spring near Cameron Street public parking.
One of the best Fajita place in the area. Surprisingly good grilled flounder, w. an extra jalapeño on the side(tender and young, not as spicy). We really enjoyed the Saturday lunch.

So this was a mixed bag for me. My favorite places to explore and rate are Mexican restaurants. First, the positive: they nailed it 100% on service. 100%. Beautifully dressed, very friendly greeter immediately took us to our outdoor table of choice. Second, my key for a good Mexican restaurant... Warm chips, salsa and water hit the table in under 30 seconds. The salsa is good, but very middle of the road. Probably best for mixed guests. A little sauza and pepper fixed that. Margaritas as watery. Not heavy on alcohol, not too sweet, not memorable. Good. But not a go-to. After one, my wife who loves margaritas, switched to a white wine.

As for meals. Again a mixed bag. My wife ordered steak fajitas. I ordered a grilled chicken Santa Fe burrito. Her steak came out sizzling and was fantastic. Great flavor! And I.. got the wrong meal... Didn't realize until I dug into it. Instead I got the shredded chicken enchiladas. Which is probably what I should have ordered. They are are awesome. Best part is that they flame grill the entire entree at the end, including the rice. So the cheese and rice have a great crisp to them. I noted the error and they replaced this with my grilled chicken burrito. Eh, not great. I am 90% sure the ground chicken was store bought pre cooked chicken (I know, I've had it many times) just warmed up. It definitely was the exact same length and dimensions of store bought chicken. It was very wet and no grilled flavor or bark. Also, my wife's side of beans were definitely not of Mexican taste, I feel like I've had canned ones just like this before.

So, staff is amazing, the house margaritas are fine but not a go-to, salsa is the same, and some of the food is REALLY GOOD, but it seems that it really depends on what you get. Steak and shredded chicken were a win.

We spent few hours in our company party here. Everything was great. But the drinks were too sweet. We had Margaritas and Mojitos. It was sweat and didnt even taste any alchohol on it. Food was ok. Staff was very friendly and chexked on us every 10 to 15 mins. Place was pretty busy for lunch and had heaters all over the place to keep inside warm.

Very pleasant lunch experience. Sat outside with my daughter on the lovely patio. Service was excellent. We both ordered enchiladas which were delicious and we have enough for leftovers. Would recommend!

Fun spot in downtown Silver Spring for a hibachi dinner. If you’re a small party of two you might have to end up waiting until there’s enough people (8 total) to show up in order for you to be seated. If you don’t care for the hibachi show then you can just be seated at the other tables.

The hibachi seats are limited, so it helps to make reservations if you have a party of 6 or more. The one downside is that because there are limited hibachi seats, we did feel a bit rushed to eat because they’re trying to clear the area to seat the next party. They placed down boxes for leftovers and the check about 10 minutes into our actual meal (basically to tell you to hurry up and leave).

We ordered three appetizers and they all turned out really well. The main hibachi entree were also quite tasty and the portions are beyond generous.

A good spot to go for dinner before catching a movie at Ellsworth. Great location for a date night and for strolling around after dinner.

The food was delicious place clean. Portion was good amount. Between appetizer , I couldn’t finished my dinner. All of us took food back home.   Good place to  eat hibachi. It’s 30 minutes drives from downtown DC  to Maryland.  There is a parking garage next to it. There are retails stores and entertainment in the strip.

Good was great! Sat at the hibachi table and the show was great. Ordered steak and chicken and it was on point. My kid was entertained.

Food: very good. Ordered medium well steak and it came out medium well. Comes with grilled vegetables, shrimp, fried rice and noodles.

Kid friendly: they gave my kid a balloon hat, they had booster seats, and they had something I could put my baby carseat on.

Gratuity is included in the bill. 18%

I would come back again for the next special occasion :)

I went with my friend and the food and hibachi experience was great! You get so much delicious food at a great price! I got the pick 2 of shrimp and chicken for $26 and it includes noodles, rice and veggies. It was so good and the service/atmosphere was so bright and lively! Can't wait to go back next time I visit my friend!

Happy hour is great,  but sushi lovers may still want something off the regular menu!

Fried calamari + kamalaze (without cream cheese) + Alaska roll

Drink - Asian dragon berry

No Thursday special anymore btw

The young lady at the register was sweet, the man that made my drink was nice the two star is for them... BUT everything else terrible, my drink was a cup full of ice, the floor was dirty and the bathroom worse.
Awesome staff and great service! Never had a disappointing day. Definitely a daily go to spot.

I think this Starbucks is rlly good l. The food that I ordered was made perfectly and the service was good. The only thing that I was hesitant about was the fact that there were loads of homeless people there. And they kept asking me for money. But apart from that, everything was 😍😍🤩.

I’m only writing this review because FEVEN WAS PHENOMENAL. Everyone else acts like doing anything like putting the extra caramel I paid for in the cup is gonna cost them an arm and a leg BUT FEVEN offers superior customer service.
Cashier was friendly and gave good recommendations.  The barista that made my drink, checked with me to make sure he had my "random" request correct. The upscale hot cocoa was delicious!

This place is a true gem in downtown Silver Spring. Yes, some rolls are pricier than most other sushi places, but the quality of the rolls make it worth the price. Their ramen was also really amazing. Ikko overall had a cozy atmosphere and the service was great — everyone was extremely friendly.

Small cute restaurant. Very well organized and clean. Excellent service, staff is super polite, friendly and gentle. Menu have good selection and great food. Theres nothing else to ask for. I like the fact where they open late where we can stop by after work for dinner. Definitely coming back!

-Environment:clean and pretty. Employees dress traditional Japanese uniforms.
-Service: friendly and fast. Would tell you which dish takes longer to cook.
-Food: so fresh and delicious.
The staff were all so cheery, and helpful! Menu is well put together, portions aren't so huge you can't eat them and the sushi is to die for!
Great food, location, and staff! I recently ordered  the seafood salad and a spicy tuna roll and they were both amazing! This is my new favorite sushi spot- I will be back soon!

This was our first time having McGinty’s brunch! I was pleasantly surprised by each dish. Everything was delicious. We ordered the American breakfast, banana custard French toast and Turkish eggs. We definitely will be back!

Lively atmosphere. TV's are a decent size to watch soccer. Friendly staff. The Irish breakfast was pretty good.  They use real rashers not American bacon. Only problem was that they served uncooked pancakes twice:-( Grateful the manager (?) Was able to wait in the kitchen till a good batch was done.
Nice place to eat. Clean tables!!!! ( thank you) very nice and accommodating employees. Would definitely eat here again. There is a bar. They have televisions.

My first time trying McGinty's brunch.  So many good dishes made it hard to choose.  I finally decided on the Irish Eggs Benedict with an Apple Cider Mule pairing, and was very happy with my choice.  I definately will be back to try the other dishes.  Thank you McGinty's for a wonderful dining experience.

Good atmosphere, very easy to get to from the public garage across the street. We ordered from the brunch menu: fish and chips, the Irish Breakfast, and the American Breakfast. All were very good. Of course the beer was good.

We ate in the downstairs bar, which had high tables and two or three booths. The stools are uncomfortable but it's a pub so what do you expect? Did not go to the upstairs bar, maybe we'll check it out next time.

Lots of stuff to do afterwards in the area within walking distance.

We’ve been wanting to try this place for awhile now, especially during the warmer months when you can sit outside on their front porch area. We were in a sandwich mood and decided to check out their original Cubano sandwich as well as the Cubano Especial. The prices seemed a bit steep, but it was nice supporting a local business. I really wanted to try their picadillo ($20+), so maybe next time we’ll have to do that. We went at around 7:30pm on a Friday night and there were plenty of seats (granted the temperature was 34°F and nobody wants to leave the warmth of their house). This place is usually packed during warmer months.

I came here this past Saturday, it was nice, good music playing, not too busy. Loved the service! The server was very attentive, but also not too intrusive. The mojito was made to perfection. I ordered “la ropa vieja” and it was fantastic. I love how everything complimented so well. The food came out at a good pace. We got the tres leches for dessert and it was amazing. Definitely will come back :) it was also my first time coming.

Idk where I've been but clearly I've been missing out!

I was in the area and stopped by to pick up some food and decided on the Churrasco a la Brasa which is flank steak served with rice, black beans and plantains.

While waiting for my food, Alex asked me if I wanted a drink. I tried the mojito. Omg, omg, omggggg it was SO good. I won't lie, I felt a bit tipsy afterwards too lol. The mojito came with raw sugarcane, a nice little touch.

The meal was VERY delicious. The steak was seasoned well and so tender. The only bummer was that they forgot to give me the chimichurri for the steak. I love that sauce and I'm sure it would've made the steak go from a 10 to a 15.

Overall, great experience. Loved the ambience. Staff was awesome and I would love to go back soon.

Very average experience, this place use to be good I am unsure what transpired through the pandemic. The food was bland. Slow service, unenthusiastic waiters, our server was not interested in her job during our meal. Younger waiters on their phones in the small corner right next to the bar area talking about patrons in spanish and laughing. They ran out of soft drinks, my date didn’t taste any alcohol in his mojito. I ordered a paella and calamari appetizer.  They sat all guest along the tables against the wall, I felt bad I even recommended this place to my guest.

Welcoming, friendly and cozy, there’s ample seating amongst oil paintings and other decor. Staff is super kind and food is clearly all freshly made for each patron. The sangria is GOOD!highly recommend, especially to other silver springers that are considering going to dc for dinner. skip the traffic, the reservations and the disappointment and head here.

Fun, "Cheers-y" style everyone-knows-your-name ambience. Place is definitely very old and has a sense of history.

I'm going 4 stars b/c the food was good, but not great, and probably not commensurate with the prices they're charging. I think they need to work on the menu a little. They said they'd ended their raw bar b/c of COVID. I hope they can bring it back.

Lot of good elements at this place. If they could kick the food up a notch, it would be a must-visit.
It’s got history this place is worth it simple but the crab cakes are the bomb and the fish love the staff❤️‍🔥❤️‍🔥❤️‍🔥

I’ve been dining at Crisfields for over 30 years and still find the food to be very tasty and comforting… Most recently since COVID, the bar has opened back up & this has been my favorite experience eating in.. Dennis & Javier hands down, run this place flawlessly… not to take away from the kitchen staff, these two guys are handling everything from ringing customers up, taking orders & serving the bar & dinning area… Kudos for Dennis & Javier for their commitment & Customer Service..

We've been going to Chrisfields for 30 years. However in the past 2-3 months, we received shrimp that smelled like ammonia, 3 times. We called each time. We hate "returns" but this time we drove all the way back in the rain to return it. They gave us a replacement dinner so that was nice, but no-one apologized for any inconvenience. Do beware of the stuffed shrimp.

I haven't eaten at Crisfields in about 5 years. It must have been closed for awhile as the counter bar was closed and two young men and a very young girl were the front of house as well as being the servers. They did a very good job (a bit of a learning curve was going on). I only saw some deep fried meals amongst the customers while I had a cup of seafood bisque (yummm) and a fried soft shell crab sandwich with cole slaw. They were also very good. I gave it four stars instead of five as I'm not sure to what extent they are serving non deep fried food like in the "old days".  To be continued...
